intro: Ilysanthes saginoides, commonly known as the mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind, allowing it to colonize rocky and arid environments. Ilysanthes saginoides is adapted to cold climates and can survive in nutrient-poor soils. Its resilience and unique floral structure make it an important species in alpine ecosystems.
